alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 02 at 1:33AM EDT until May 02 at 4:14AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by yesterday`s excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 133 AM EDT, the public reported roads in the area continue to remain underwater. Rivers and small streams will remain high tonight. - Water levels will very slowly recede tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dover-Foxcroft, Greenville, Guilford, Brownville Junction, Milo, Monson, Blanchard, Elliottsville, Kingsbury Plantation, Ebeemee, Orneville, Sangerville, Brownville, Parkman, Abbot, Sebec, Atkinson, Wellington, Shirley and Willimantic. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
